page.title: 06GREAT MEOLS:THE CHURCH.
page.content: {St.John The Baptist,Parish Church. Evening services are recorded as first being held at Great Meols School(1880) and by 1899 morning services were approved by the Vicar of Hoylake. In December,1900, a building committee was elected and,at a cost of Â£500,a temporary church was erected prior to that of a permament place of worship. However Meols was growing in size and the temporary church was inadequate. Fund raising activities+loans enabled the consecration of the present church on the 12/4/1913 by the Lord Bishop of Chester.Only the Tower,Lady Chapel and Sanctuary remaining to be built. The church was finally completed after its Jubilee Year of 1963. The present vicar is the Rev.Pritchard B.Eng. THe church has a capacity for 400 and attracts a congregation of 170. {
